subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Lion Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Lion hail from a region of dense and dark forests brimming with dangerous and deadly beasts; the Sons of The Lion form Knightly Orders that hunt down and slay these vile beasts to protect their towns and villages from the slaughter wrought by the denizens of the forests.

entries.name: Knightly Hunters
entries: At 3rd level you gain hooded robes designed to be worn over your armour in addition to your starting equipment. You also have significant training in tracking, hunting, and slaying a certain type of enemy. Choose a type of enemy: aberrations, beasts or monstrosities. You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your chosen enemies, on Intelligence checks to recall information about them and on attack rolls made against them.
You also choose one additional enemy type, at 10th and 18th level.

entries.name: Watcher in the Dark
entries: Starting at 7th level when you make an opportunity attack with longswords or greatswords, you make it with advantage.
You also gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks.

entries.name: Knightly Hunters Improvement
entries: At 10th level you may choose an additional enemy type for your Knightly Hunters Feature.

entries.name: The Unbroken Sword
entries: At 10th level you can parry one enemy melee attack as a reaction whilst holding a longsword or greatsword, granting a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency against the attack whilst you are holding the weapon.

entries.name: Knightly Swordsmanship
entries: At 15th level your skill with the sword grants you a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with longswords and greatswords.

entries.name: Knightly Hunters Improvement
entries: At 18th level you may choose another additional enemy type for your Knightly Hunters Feature.

entries.name: Precision with the Blade
entries: At 18th level your melee weapon attacks with greatswords and longswords score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20 and you can re-roll damage die of 1 or 2 but must take the second roll.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Phoenician Martial Archetype
entries: Perfectionists through and through, be it in martial warfare or the arts, the Sons of the Phoenician strive to be the best at what they lay their hands to, creating some of the finest duellists and artisans.

entries.name: Artistic Indulgence
entries: At 3rd level you gain proficiency in two artisan's tools from the following list: Calligrapher's supplies, Glassblower's tools, Jeweller's Tools, Painter's Supplies, Potter's Supplies, Woodcarver's tools, or any musical instrument.

entries.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 7th level you gain an additional fighting style from the list. You may not choose the same fighting style twice.
At 15th level you may choose another additional fighting style.

entries.name: Martial Pride
entries: At 10th level you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls when you're attacking a creature in melee that has a challenge rating (or level) equal to or higher than your level.
However you take a -2 penalty to attack rolls against creatures with a challenge rating (or level) lower than a quarter of your level. This bonus or penalty is cumulative with a fighting style.

entries.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 15th level you gain an additional fighting style from the list. You may not choose the same fighting style twice.

entries.name: Fast Reflexes
entries: At 15th level you've honed your reactions and gain a +5 bonus to your Initiative.

entries.name: The Maru Skara
entries: At 18th level your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Iron Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Iron are bonded by a mutual brotherhood forged by their own hatred and bitter paranoia. Masters of long range and siege warfare they are as cold and hard as their name implies. Chanting ‘The Unbreakable Litany' as they methodically cut down their foes without remorse.

entries.name: Vicious Weaponry
entries: Starting at 3rd level when wielding a flail, a maul or a warhammer, you can prepare yourself to extend your swing to sweep over targets' shields as a bonus action on your turn. Until the end of this turn, your attack rolls with these weapons gain a +2 bonus against any target using a shield.

entries.name: Siege Expert
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency with smith's tools and mason's tools. You also gain advantage on Intelligence checks relating to offensive siege warfare.

entries.name: Hammer of Iron
entries: Starting at 10th level whenever you have disadvantage on a melee attack roll you make with a flail, a maul or a warhammer, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but if the higher of the two d20 rolls would have hit.

entries.name: Iron Within, Iron Without
entries: At 15th level you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed.
Additionally you gain the following benefits while you are wielding a shield:

items: If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can use a bonus action to try to shove a creature within 5 feet of you with your shield.
If you aren't incapacitated, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

If you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

entries.name: Artillery Volley
entries: At 18th level you do not have disadvantage when attacking a target beyond a weapon's normal range. If you're attacking a target beyond a weapon's normal range you can make a single additional attack against the same target as a bonus action.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Khan Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Khan are often recruited from the nomad tribes that inhabit the steppes of their homeland. Their savage fury is tempered by a fierce sense of honour and justice, as they engage in lightning fast cavalry strikes to run down their foes.

entries.name: Skilled Rider
entries: At 3rd level you gain proficiency with the Animal Handling skill and Vehicles (Land). You are able to move normally both on foot and on a mount through non-magical difficult terrain. Additionally you make take the dash action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Born to the Saddle
entries: Starting at 7th level, your mastery as a rider becomes apparent. You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and descend no more than 10 feet, you can land on your feet if you're not incapacitated. Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature costs you only 5 feet of movement, rather than half your speed.

entries.name: Mounted Superiority
entries: At 10th level you gain advantage on melee attack rolls with scimitars and glaives against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your mount if you yourself are mounted.

entries.name: Vigilant Defender
entries: At 15th level you can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead. If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Ferocious Charger
entries: At 18th level, you can run down your foes, whether you're mounted or not. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line towards a creature and hit it with a melee attack on your turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked prone. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Wolf King Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Wolf hail from the frozen wilds teeming with packs of winter wolves, they are outwardly savage and seem little better than the creatures from which they draw their name-sake. However behind this ruse lies a fierce cunning and loyalty few other Astartes could match.

entries.name: Headstrong
entries: Starting at 3rd level when you move at least 10 feet towards a creature and take the attack action against it on your turn, you gain a +2 bonus to melee attack rolls made against that creature until the end of your turn.

entries.name: Environmental Adaptation
entries: At 7th level your enhanced body has adapted to the cold, making you noticeably very hirsute. You gain a resistance to Cold damage.

entries.name: Runes of Warding
entries: At 10th level you decorate your armour with runes and totems of warding, a custom from the tribes native to the The Wolf King's homeland. Once a day you can gain advantage on a saving throw against a spell or halve the damage from a spell attack against you.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Starting at 15th level you gain advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Howl of Winter
entries: When you reach 18th level you feel now more than ever the beast lurking inside you. As a bonus action you may emit a blood curdling howl, dropping any weapons or shields you are holding as you unleash the wolf within. For the next minute your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 + your Strength modifier in slashing damage. You may only use your unarmed strikes when you take the attack action, but the number of attacks you make is doubled.
Additionally you gain a bite attack that deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier in piercing damage; you can use this bite attack as a bonus action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you may use it again.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Praetorian Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Praetorian are masters in the art of fortress building, the work of their craft is nigh impregnable and has stood undaunted for thousands of years much like the Sons themselves.

entries.name: Unfaltering Fire
entries: At 3rd level you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. Additionally if you're in three-quarters cover you can use your bonus action to make a single additional ranged attack if you took the attack action on your turn. Starting at 15th level this also includes half cover.

entries.name: Fortress-Craft
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency with carpenter's tools and mason's tools. You also gain advantage on Intelligence checks relating to defensive siege warfare.

entries.name: Steady Marksman
entries: At 10th level you gain advantage on ranged attacks whilst in at least three-quarters cover. At 18th level this also includes half-cover.

entries.name: Firing Drill
entries: Starting at 15th level if you move 0ft on your turn you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with crossbows (light, heavy, hand, etc) and you ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.

entries.name: Phalanx
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your action to plant your shield in the ground to create a 5ft wide by 4ft tall area of half cover as long as your shield is big enough to provide that size of cover (at your DM's discretion). This cover lasts until the shield is either destroyed or uprooted as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Night Martial Archetype
entries: Drawn from the worst cutthroats and criminals in the land, the Sons of The Night are cruel and callous murderers who decorate their armour with the bones and flayed skin of their enemies, stalking the shadows like supernatural predators.

entries.name: Selfish Blood
entries: When you take this archetype at 3rd level you can use your bonus action to dash if you used your action to disengage.

entries.name: Throwing Daggers
entries: At 7th level if you have a dagger in your inventory you can use your bonus action to throw the dagger at a creature within 10ft with advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Night Terrors
entries: At 10th level you gain proficiency in the Stealth and Intimidation skills. If you are already proficient in one of these skills, your proficiency bonus is doubled for that skill.

entries.name: Cruel Counter
entries: Starting at 15th level when you take the Attack action and attack with only a glaive, halberd, or quarterstaff, you can use your bonus action to make a melee attack with the opposite end of the weapon. This attack uses the same ability modifier as the primary weapon. The weapon's damage die for this attack is a d6, and the attack deals bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: A Talent for Murder
entries: At 18th level you gain +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls against a creature if the number of your allies who aren't incapacitated within 5 feet of the creature is greater the number of the creature's allies who aren't incapacitated within 5 feet of the creature.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Angel Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Angel are noble and fierce fighters that hide a dark and terrible secret. Whilst appearing as one of the more upstanding heritages they're cursed with an unending thirst for blood that gives rise to rumours amongst those who would dare speak ill about them.

entries.name: Rapid Strikes
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you learn to trade accuracy for swift strikes. If you take the Attack action on your turn and have advantage on an attack roll against one of the targets, you can forgo the advantage for that roll to make an additional weapon attack against that target, as part of the same action. You can do so no more than once per turn.

entries.name: Fighting Spirit
entries: Starting at 7th level your intensity in battle can shield you and help you strike true. As a bonus action on your turn, you can give yourself advantage on weapon attack rolls until the end of the current turn.
You can use this feature three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Red Thirst
entries: At 10th level, after killing an enemy in melee make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC of 5, on a failed save you're filled with blood thirst and you must use your next action to consume the flesh and blood of the slain, gaining 1d6 hit points when doing so. The DC for the throw goes up to DC10 after three days of not consuming blood.

entries.name: Without Relent, Without Remorse
entries: Starting at 15th level, as a reaction when an enemy creature leaves your area of engagement, you may forgo your attack of opportunity to follow the creature up to half your movement speed and then make your attack if they're still in range to do so. However you cannot voluntarily take cover or go prone in combat.

entries.name: Martial Prowess
entries: Starting at 18th level, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls in melee. Additionally your melee weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19 or 20 if you have advantage on the attack.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Gorgon Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Gorgon value strength above all else, resenting even their own enhanced flesh and preferring the cold certainty of steel; going so far as coat their own hands with plates of mithril to show their devotion.

entries.name: Manus Tenet Ferrum
entries: Starting at 3rd level you take part in the Manus Tenet Ferrum, a ritual which coats your hands and forearms in segments of magic-infused mithril. You add double your Strength modifier to your unarmed attack's damage rolls.
At 10th level this also applies to two melee weapons of your choice that you have proficiency with.

entries.name: Metallurgy Master
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency smith's and tinker's tools and gain advantage on Knowledge (Intelligence) checks relating to metallurgy and to identify types of metal.

entries.name: Stand and Fight
entries: Starting at 10th level you cannot voluntarily take cover or go prone in combat and cannot voluntarily take the disengage action.

entries.name: Vengeful Strike
entries: Starting at 15th level when you hit with an opportunity attack using a warhammer, mace or maul the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Inviolate Armour
entries: At 18th level whilst wearing heavy armour you can negate non-magical damage from ranged attacks. When hit by a ranged attack, roll 2d8 and subtract the number rolled from the attack's damage. This reduction is done before any applicable resistances or vulnerabilities are taken into account. However you suffer a -1 penalty to your initiative value.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Slaughterer Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Slaughterer are bloodthirsty and barbaric, bordering on the outright insane. Primal gladiators of raw violence that revel in bloodshed, they're eventually driven to madness by the Butcher's Nails boring into their brains. They make terrifying opponents that leave naught but rent and riven corpses in their wake.

entries.name: Manus Tenet Ferrum
entries: Starting at 3rd level you may re-roll dice rolls of 1 on damage dice for melee weapon attacks, however you must accept the second roll even if it is worse. At 10th level you may also re-roll dice rolls of 2 as well.

entries.name: Murderous Rage
entries: At 7th level magic-infused metal rods known as the Butcher's Nails are implanted into your brain. When you kill an enemy you must make a Wisdom saving throw with a DC equal to 5 + the number of creatures you've reduced to 0 hit points since you last finished a long rest.

On a failed save you enter a Murderous Rage, gaining advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, 1d4 bonus damage to melee attacks which goes up to 2d4 at 15th level. You also gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage. On your turn you must move as far as you can towards the nearest enemy creature in range, and use your attack action against it. If there are no hostile creatures within view then any creature (including friendly creatures) within view becomes your target. If you are unable to attack a target after using your full movement you must use your action to dash towards the target; if this enables you to reach your target you can make one melee attack at disadvantage as a bonus action. If you are unable to attack a target on your turn you take 1d8 psychic damage. Attacks against you have advantage.

Your murderous rage ends if: Your rage has lasted 1 minute and you have not attacked a creature on your previous turn, you are knocked unconscious by any means or if you've not attacked any creatures during your last two turns. If any of these conditions are met at the end of one of your turns, your Murderous Rage ends and you take 2d8 psychic damage. Murderous Rage can only occur once per short rest.

entries.name: Violence Incarnate
entries: Starting at 10th level when you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Unstoppable Monster
entries: Starting at 15th level when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you instead remain on 1 hit point and gain 1d12 + your Constitution modifier in temporary hit points, entering a Murderous Rage if you're not already in one. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Eightfold Path
entries: At 18th level when you take the attack action and make at least one melee attack, you may make two additional attacks with a bonus action.

Due to their continued effects on your brain the Butcher's Nails increase your aggression even further, your Murderous Rage is no longer limited to once per short rest and the DC for the wisdom saving throw you take when killing an enemy is now 10 + the number of enemies you've reduced to 0 hit points since you last finished a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Regent Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Regent are empire builders in their entirety, priding themselves on the small dominion they carved themselves in the land. Trained in squad warfare they fight alongside one another with almost supernatural precision.

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can on your turn use your bonus action to use one of the Combat Tactics detailed below. You can do this a number of times equal to a quarter of your level (rounded down, to a minimum of 1). Expended uses replenish on a short rest.

items.name: With me, as one!
entries: You may, after hitting a target with an attack, use your bonus action to choose up to 3 friendly creatures to gain advantage on their attack rolls against the target hit by your attack until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Focus Fire!
entries: You gain advantage on attack rolls against a target that's already been hit by an ally's attack this round.

items.name: Rally to me brothers!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures, they all gain temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

items.name: Hold the line!
entries: Choose up to 3 friendly creatures which may include yourself. If a hostile creature comes within 5 feet of one of these creatures, said creature may use their reaction to make a single melee attack against the creature.

entries.name: And They Shall Know No Fear
entries: At 7th level you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws that would cause you to become frightened or flee from a hostile creature.
At 15th level this includes Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Know Your Enemy
entries: At 10th level you gain advantage on Knowledge (Arcana) and Knowledge (Nature) checks to identify the weaknesses of an enemy.

entries.name: And They Shall Know No Fear
entries: At 15th level you also have advantage on Charisma saving throws that would cause you to become frightened or flee from a hostile creature.

entries.name: Diverse Training
entries: Starting at 15th level, you can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to 2 skills of your choice from the list under class features that you are not proficient with.

entries.name: Coup De Grâce
entries: At 18th level you can make a Coup De Grâce attack. The target of this attack requires a head. Using your action make a single attack roll with a weapon. On a hit, the target makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + the difference between your attack roll and the target's AC. If they fail the save they are dealt a mortal blow, such as a decaptiation, are reduced to 0 hitpoints and die outright. If they succeed they take five times the damage rolled for the attack you used. You can use this feature once per long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Reaper Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Reaper are macabre masters of poison and decay. Revelling in their resistance to toxins even other astartes cannot handle and delighting in the rot and ruin they bring to others, their unwavering advance cutting down their quarry like the very scythes they wield.

entries.name: Manreaper
entries: At 3rd level you gain proficiency with Manreapers, a large and vicious scythe weapon. You can spend 1 hour and 10gp to craft a warpick into a Manreaper. Resembling a large scythe it now deals slashing damage instead of piercing and it gains the versatile (1d10) property. If you are wielding it with two hands you may make your attack at disadvantage to target up to three creatures that are within 5 feet of you and adjacent to each other.

entries.name: Toxic Obsession
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency with the poisoner's kit and you can apply poison to a weapon or 10 pieces of ammunition as a bonus action on your turn. The poison applied also retains its potency for as long as the item remains in your possession.

entries.name: Portents of Rot
entries: At 10th level you gain immunity to Poison damage and you are immune to the Poisoned and Frightened conditions.
At 18th level you also gain resistance to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Implacable Advance
entries: At 15th level your movement speed can never be decreased below 5 feet. Effects that would cause you to be unable to move, like the Paralyzed condition, will still stop you from moving.

entries.name: Portents of Rot
entries: At 18th level you also gain resistance to Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Plaguebringer
entries: At 18th level you can use your bonus action to enchant your weapon. For one minute your attacks deal extra Necrotic damage equal to half the damage rolled (rounded down).

Additionally a creature hit by your attacks while this feature is active must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the start its turn or become poisoned and take 2d8 Poison damage; the save has a DC of 8 + your Constitution modifier. On a successful save the creature is not poisoned and takes half of the poison damage.
You can regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

{@filter Spells Known|spells|subclass=Fighter: Sons of The Crimson King}

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Crimson King Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Crimson King are renown wizards, lore-masters of the arcane arts and practitioners of dangerous magicks. They possess an arrogance and hubris in their arcane abilities that may well be their undoing.

entries.name: Guiding Tutelary
entries: At 3rd level you gain proficiency in the Arcana and History skills.

Additionally you gain a tutelary, a celestial, fey or fiend familiar that exists on the astral plane who is controlled by the Dungeon Master. Once a day during a short rest you can meditate and ask it three questions; the Dungeon Master has discretion if the answers are true or false, obvious or cryptic and whether or not your tutelary would actually know the answers you seek.

entries.name: Spell Scrolls
entries: At 7th level you gain the ability to create spell scrolls. You may possess a number of them equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1); if you create an additional scroll above your limit, you choose which of the pre-existing scrolls is destroyed.

When you find a wizard spell, you can copy it to a spell scroll if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it. For each level of the spell, the process takes 1 hour and costs 25 gp. The cost represents material components you expend making the scroll and the fine inks you need to record the spell itself.

When you copy a spell from an existing spell scroll, you must succeed on an Intelligence (Arcana) check with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll being copied from is destroyed.

entries.name: Arcane Awakening
entries: At 10th level you begin to unlock your true magical potential, learning to reach into the warp and weave of the unseen world to draw forth power.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. You learn additional wizard cantrips of your choice at 13th level, 16th level and 19th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Sons of The Crimson King Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest. For example, when you are 17th level, you have three 3rd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell thunderwave, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 10th level, you know one 1st-level spell of your choice from the wizard spell list. You learn one additional spell from the wizard spell list each time you gain a level.

A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level and must come from the same school of magic as your spells of 1st level and higher. When you reach 16th level, for example, you learn a new wizard spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the wizard spells you know and replace it with another spell from the wizard spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots and the same school of magic as your spells of 1st level and higher.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your wizard spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Finally when you cast a spell you risk the chance that your magic becomes unstable and uncontrollable, damaging you and others around you. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, roll an Intelligence save with a DC equal to 5 + the spell slot level being used.

On a failed save the spell still takes place but you cause a surge in wild magic, after resolving the spell's effects roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to determine the effects. In addition you take a number of d10 equal to the spell's level in psychic damage.

entries.name: Psychic Weaponry
entries: At 15th level you can use a melee weapon you are holding as a spellcasting focus.

Additionally you can use your bonus action when holding a melee weapon to imbue it with magical power by expending a spell slot. The next hit with that melee weapon deals an additional 1d8 psychic damage per spell slot level used. The magical power in the weapon fades after 1 minute if not used or as soon as you are no longer holding the melee weapon.

entries.name: Arcane Discipline
entries: At 18th level you gain a bonus depending on what school of magic you've chosen for your spells.

entries.name: Abjuration
entries: You can weave magic around yourself for protection. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can simultaneously use a strand of the spell's magic to create a magical ward on yourself that lasts until you finish a long rest. The ward has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.

While the ward has 0 hit points, it can't absorb damage, but its magic remains. Whenever you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell.
Once you create the ward, you can't create it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Conjuration
entries: While you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.

entries.name: Divination
entries: Glimpses of the future begin to press in on your awareness. When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn.
Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a long rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

entries.name: Enchantment
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to divert the attack, provided that another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw against your wizard spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including you or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. On a successful save, you can't use this feature on the attacker again until you finish a long rest.
You must choose to use this feature before knowing whether the attack hits or misses. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Evocation
entries: You can create pockets of relative safety within the effects of your evocation spells. When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Illusion
entries: You can create an illusory duplicate of yourself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to interpose the illusory duplicate between the attacker and yourself. The attack automatically misses you, then the illusion dissipates.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Necromancy
entries: You gain the ability to reap life energy from creatures you kill with your spells. Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spell's level, or three times its level if the spell belongs to the School of Necromancy. You don't gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

entries.name: Transmutation
entries: You add the polymorph spell to your spellbook, if it is not there already. You can cast polymorph without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can target only yourself and transform into a beast whose challenge rating is 1 or lower.
Once you cast polymorph in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Lupercal Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Lupercal are considered the first and foremost amongst their many kin. They are a formidable force that often form the tip of the spear for a attacking army, poised to drive deep into the enemy's throat and cut off their head in a swift and decisive move.

entries.name: Adaptable
entries: When you take this archetype at 3rd level you gain two extra skill proficiencies from the list of skills presented under class features, or you may choose one of your skill proficiencies; your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen proficiency.

entries.name: Pile In!
entries: At 7th level you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Merciless Fighter
entries: At 10th level you can use your bonus action to make a single unarmed strike.

Additionally at the end of a creature within your reach's turn, you can use your reaction to make a single unarmed strike against that creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Close Combat
entries: At 15th level being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.
Additionally when you use the Attack action and attack with a one-handed weapon, you can use a bonus action to attack with a one-handed ranged weapon you are holding.

entries.name: Bone Breaker
entries: Starting at 18th level when you score a critical hit with a melee attack you may attempt to cripple your foe. The creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier or be incapacitated, have their movement reduced to 5 ft. and be knocked prone. This effect remains until they are healed by a spell such as greater restoration.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Word Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Word are fanatics and zealots, contrary to the other Sons who are largely secular the Sons of the Word embrace the polar extremes of faith with fervour, channelling their devotion into every action.

entries.name: Divine Devotion
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level you gain a holy symbol of either a lawful good deity or a chaotic evil deity (your choice). You also gain proficiency in the Persuasion and Religion skills.

entries.name: Banishment
entries: At 7th level when you successfully hit a creature with a melee attack roll using a simple weapon that deals bludgeoning damage or a morningstar, you can try to push the creature back. The creature makes a Strength saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Strength modifier, on a failed save the creature is pushed 15 feet away from you and knocked prone.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier (minimum of 1). You regain any expended uses of this feature once you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Zealous Crusader
entries: At 10th level you gain a number of zeal dice equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), which are d4s. You can roll a die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw you make.

Alternatively, when an attack roll is made against you, you can use your reaction to roll the Zeal die and add the number rolled to your AC against that attack, after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it hits or misses.
A zeal die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended zeal dice when you finish a long rest. At 18th level your Zeal dice are now d6s.

entries.name: Undaunted
entries: At 15th level your tenacity and fervent faith spreads to others, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be frightened while you are conscious.

entries.name: The Power of Faith
entries: At 18th level you can use you action to pray to your deity for help. On your turn roll a d20 and add your Charisma modifier against a DC equal to your Charisma score.

On a success you add your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) to either: your AC and saving throws if the deity you chose is lawful good or your attack and damage rolls if the deity you chose is chaotic evil.
You need to finish a long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Drake Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Drake are master craftsmen who claim their lineage descends from the dragons themselves. They focus on who they can save before what they can fight and are generally held in high regard for their consideration towards common-folk during conflicts.

entries.name: Draconic Bloodline
entries: At 3rd level you can speak, read and write Draconic, you gain resistance to Fire damage and weapons that cause Fire damage do twice as much Fire damage when wielded by you.

entries.name: Hammer and Anvil
entries: At 7th level if you are attacking an enemy with a warhammer or maul when they are flanked by a wall or one of your allies with a shield the weapon damage you roll is doubled.

entries.name: Helping Hand
entries: At 10th level if you use the Help action to aid an ally's melee attack while you're wielding a warhammer or maul, you knock the target's defence aside momentarily. In addition to the ally gaining advantage on the attack roll, the ally gains a +2 bonus to the roll.

entries.name: Forgemaster
entries: Starting at 15th level your knowledge with the forge and the arts of smithing allow you to upgrade your weapons and armor to be more effective.

For each level you want to upgrade the weapon the process takes 3 hours and costs five times the item's value in gold. The cost represents the materials required to improve the weapon; for each level of upgrade a weapon gains a +1 to its attack and damage rolls or a piece of armour gains +1 to its AC.
The maximum number of levels you can upgrade a weapon is 2; at 18th level the maximum increases to 3.

entries.name: Forgemaster
entries: At 18th level the maximum number of levels you can upgrade a weapon with your Forgemaster feature increases to 3.

entries.name: The Unbound Flame
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your bonus action to ignite a melee weapon you are holding, once ignited it deals an extra 2d6 fire damage for 1 minute and is considered a magic weapon.

Creatures hit by your weapon while this feature is active must succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency + your Constitution modifier at the start of their next turn or take an additional 2d4 fire damage.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Raven Martial Archetype
entries: The Sons of The Raven are dark mannered and brooding, their sombre nature belying their true power. Masters of fast, harrowing attacks that are over as swiftly as they begin, leaving only death behind.

entries.name: Hit and Run
entries: At 3rd level you've learnt how to use quick retreats between your attacks to avoid danger. You may disengage as a bonus action.

entries.name: Silence
entries: At 7th level you gain proficiency in the Stealth skill and armour no longer imposes disadvantage to Stealth checks.

entries.name: Death By A Thousand Cuts
entries: Starting at 10th level, while you are wielding a separate melee weapon with the light property in each hand you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with those weapons.

entries.name: Untouchable
entries: Starting at 15th level you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated and are aware of the attacker.

entries.name: Nevermore
entries: When you reach 18th level you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, if you have advantage on your first attack roll using a weapon with the light property, you can deal three times the damage rolled; this only applies to your first attack and not any subsequent attacks on your turn.

subclassFeatures.name: Sons of The Hydra Martial Archetype
entries: Little is known about the Sons of The Hydra, rumours persist that there is only one in existance at any time, despite tales to the contrary, undoubtedly they indulge in deception and subterfuge on a machiavellian scale.

entries.name: The Many Heads of The Hydra
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level you always, whenever you're asked your name by someone whom you do not trust, simply reply: "I am one of many." or some other thematic variation there upon. Your true name is kept secret or is simply forgotten.
You gain proficiency in the Deception skill, disguise kits, and forgery kits. Additionally you have advantage on rolls to disguise yourself as someone of the same race.

entries.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 7th level you may choose one bonus from the following list:
You may dash as a bonus action.
You may disengage as a bonus action.
You gain proficiency in the Stealth skill or your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make if you are already proficient.
You may use your reaction to make an attack against a creature that enters your reach.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with melee weapons you are proficient with.
You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with range weapons you are proficient with.
You gain +2 to Initiative rolls.
Moving through non-magical difficult terrain does not cost extra feet of movement.
You gain proficiency in Dexterity saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Intelligence saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.
You gain proficiency in Charisma saving throws.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make in one skill you have proficiency in.
You gain a new skill from those listed in the class features.
You may change your selection when you finish a long rest.
At 15th level you may choose a second bonus from the list, you may not choose the same bonus more than once.

entries.name: Deadly Improvisation
entries: At 10th level you become proficient with Improvised Weapons and can use your bonus action to grapple a target hit with an improvised weapon or unarmed attack.

entries.name: Mutable Tactics
entries: At 15th level you may choose a second bonus from the list in your Mutable Tactics feature; you may not choose the same bonus more than once.

entries.name: Sever One Head...
entries: Starting at 15th level when you take damage you can use your reaction to cast mirror image. Whilst the spell is active you gain a +1 bonus to your damage rolls for every duplicate you have remaining.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Blood of The Primogenitor
entries: Starting at 18th level you can use your action to unleash the Blood of The Primogenitor. For 1 minute you gain a +2 bonus to your Strength and Constitution scores, you can make a single additional attack on your turn as a bonus action, and your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Any hitpoints gained by the increase to your Constitution modifier are added to your temporary hitpoints rather than your hitpoint maximum.
You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest.
